conclusion: The solid line represents the boundary between air and water.
A beam of blue light travels from point A in the air along AO1 direction into the water.
Point O is the intersection of lines AB and the boundary.
The light beam travels from point A in the air along AO1 direction into the water.
The light then passes through point B in the water.
Point O1 is the point where the light beam intersects the boundary between air and water.
Since the light beam passes through point B in the water, and point O1 is the point where the light beam intersects the boundary, it follows that point O1 is to the right of point O.
Yes, point O1 is to the right of point O.
